intro: Terminalia chicharronia subsp. domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican tamarind, is a deciduous tree native to the Caribbean, particularly the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elongated, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by yellow, fleshy fruits that are edible and used in local cuisines. Its botanical significance lies in its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
